column4: hi. I have a drive that isn't mounting... How can I see a list of drives that the OS 'sees" ?
bash: /dev/disk/by-label: No such file or directory
Unless you mean that I should guess at the 'by-label' part ... but doesn't seem like an efficient way of doing things
that asssumes the disk is sda .... what if its hda or hdb or sdb or sdc ?
there should be a way to list drives that the OS sees ... without guessing at what type is attached
that would be ld /dev/disk/by-label but apparently the os sees no drives
what do you get when you ls /dev/disk?
thats funny. I tried it on my system I'm on right now... definately has a drive
thatnks ... the command needed was:   ls /dev/disk/by-id/
